content: OpenAPI specifications should include proper authentication schemes. Common issues: missing auth, weak auth methods, exposed credentials in examples.
APIs must implement proper authorization controls. Common issues: missing role-based access, insufficient endpoint protection, privilege escalation risks.
All API inputs must be validated. Common issues: missing validation schemas, inadequate type checking, injection vulnerabilities.
APIs should not expose sensitive data unnecessarily. Common issues: returning sensitive fields, lack of field filtering, verbose error messages.
APIs must use HTTPS for all communications. Common issues: HTTP servers defined, missing security requirements, weak TLS configuration.
